channel.title: My <video> tag is broken?
channel.description:
Hi, I'm using the <video> tag to play videos on my website. Everything is all good until the video stops buffering half way.
This is my code: [php] <video class="video" controls> <source src="/videos/vid1.mp4" type="video/mp4"> Your browser does not support this type of video playback. </video>[/php]
The class is for styles.
Has anybody else had this problem? It only occurs if the video is longer then 3-5 mins +. I'm running my site locally, download speed shouldn't be an issue although it looks like it's loading the video at idk 300kbs lmfao then stops.
Help is appreciated.

item.title: My <video> tag is broken?
item.dc:creator: @Ashi Ashi
item.description:
@Ashi wrote:

Mopman:

I don’t see how it could possibly be a problem with Jekyll, assuming you mean the static site generator?

Yeah the static site generator.

Read full topic

item.title: My <video> tag is broken?
item.dc:creator: @Ashi Ashi
item.description:
@Ashi wrote:

Okay it’s not a problem with the codec or my browser. I’m assuming it’s a problem with Jekyll, when I view site/videos using GitHub, I don’t get any problems.

If anybody else is having this problem using Jekyll let me know.

Read full topic

item.title: My <video> tag is broken?
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

Pure_:

maybe codec?

Sounds like the most reasonable answer.

http://www.chromium.org/audio-video
Definitely make sure it is in H.264, and just know that browser support of the video tag is still iffy. https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Supported_media_formats#Browser_compatibility

Modernizr can be used to tell you if the browser will supports html5 video and which format, or you can take a look at http://camendesign.com/code/video_for_everybody for a nice alternative that doesn’t use javascript.

Read full topic

item.title: My <video> tag is broken?
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

support for html5 video on chrome is shit. you probably need to mess around with different encodings to find one that chrome likes.

Read full topic

item.title: My <video> tag is broken?
item.dc:creator: @Ashi Ashi
item.description:
@Ashi wrote:

Mopman:

Can you download the entire video from this server normally, without using the video tag or any download managers?

Depends what you mean by server but I can download it normally when I type the path into my browser. Take into consideration I’m doing this offline.

I’m pretty certain it’s not a problem with the actual video files if that’s what you’re thinking.

Edit: I’m starting to think this might be a problem with my browser. I’m using Chrome on Linux, I’ll double check that and let you guys know.

Read full topic
